heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Has a clear willingness to learn and apply relevant economic theory and can discuss the limits of theory when it comes to real world application.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Displays sufficient depth and breadth of understanding of core economics.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Has the ability to explain and apply theory from different branches of economics - for example applying behavioural economics to a microeconomic context, applying economic history to macroeconomics / contemporary macroeconomic context etc. Can demonstrate an emergent capability to tailor such theoretical application to their environment (role, departmental context, policy context etc).

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can explain and apply concepts in intermediate microeconomics and macroeconomics.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Is able to demonstrate elements of specialist economics knowledge in a specific field (such as international trade, industrial economics, development economics, public finance) and/or can demonstrate advanced Departmental or role-specific economic knowledge.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can explain and apply a variety of economic tools, techniques, and methods to a range of work/policy areas, making use of relevant economic theory (e.g. international trade, industrial economics, development economics, public finance) to develop/oversee the evidence base for policy development. Must demonstrate this ability across the areas of macroeconomics and microeconomics.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Able to scope areas of work identifying objectives, analytical methods, resources required and potential delivery risks.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Able to recognise when complementary expertise and collaborative working is required e.g., scientists, other social scientists, other government analytical professions and data specialists.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Understands high-level business objectives and strategy to anticipate demands for economic analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Oversees and challenges as appropriate the application of economic tools, techniques, and methods to a range of policy areas, making use of deep department-specific economic knowledge.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Scopes broad areas of work identifying objectives, analytical methods, resources required and potential delivery risks.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can recognise and digest complementary expertise from e.g., scientists, other social scientists, other government analytical professions, and data specialists.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Leads teams to deliver cohesive analytical programmes across professions.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Uses economic insight to interpret high level strategic challenges.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Co-ordinates and directs analytical resources [or workstreams] to meet departmental and ministerial objectives.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Addresses the challenges of competing priorities for resourcing of economic analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Displays an ability to assess different methods, data or results being used, and to comment on the appropriateness of these methods.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Analyses complex information and data, drawing on economic knowledge and applying it to questions of interest for the department, while being aware of the limitations of economic analysis and the available data.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Analyses and synthesises complex information and data, drawing on economic knowledge and applying it to questions of interest for the department, while being aware of the limitations/risks of economic analysis and the available data. This may include developing detailed knowledge or expertise of a technical area.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Leads development of analysis and synthesises evidence from a range of data and complex information sources, combining and developing these as appropriate. This will include building an understanding of data sources, measurement techniques and analytical debate relating to specific policy areas and ensuring issues of economic inequality and distribution are considered as required.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Is accountable and ensures consistency between analytical products delivered across teams. This will include building an understanding of the opportunities and limitations of data sources, measurement techniques and analytical debate relating to specific policy areas and ensuring issues of economic inequality and distribution are considered as required.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Creates and supports teams that challenge and improve the evidence base, draw on diverse perspectives across professional boundaries and consider economic inequality and redistribution as required.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can contribute to an economic project with support.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Works independently on an economic/analytical project.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Escalates analytical issues appropriately.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Is competent in scoping and leading analytical research design.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can take responsibility for wider analytical projects.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Uses horizon scanning methodologies to anticipate new trends, opportunities and challenges that may influence outcomes of interest to the customers.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Delivery of high quality analysis to the standards set out in the green, aqua and magenta books.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Uses horizon scanning methodologies to anticipate new trends, opportunities and challenges that may influence outcomes of interest to team/departments/stakeholders.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Leads the delivery, or contributes to delivery, of policy appraisal, impact assessments, evidence-based business cases, and evaluation to the standards set out in the Green. Aqua and Magenta Books. This will include engaging with, and bringing in expertise from, other analytical professions as appropriate.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Leads experts to deliver high quality economic analysis, critically appraising methods in line with best practice guidelines. This also includes developing and adding to best practice where possible.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Skill not generally expected at this grade. However, some roles may include identifying evidence gaps.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Undertakes analysis to fill evidence gaps identified.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Takes responsibility for wider analytical projects which address identified evidence gaps.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Expands and develops the evidence base for future policy development. This includes anticipating evidence gaps and future evidence needs, scoping work projects, managing internal and external analytical programmes and building links with academia and wider research communities.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Expands and develops the evidence base for future policy development. This includes anticipating evidence gaps and future evidence needs, scoping work programmes, managing internal and external analytical programmes, proactively building networks with academia and wider research communities. Includes finding new ways of influencing policy and keeping up to date with policy debates in the area of expertise.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Identifies where and how new analysis can provide insight into strategic challenges. Marshalls analytical resources to do so, leveraging external networks where appropriate.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Is familiar with and learning the basics of techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Learns and applies techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to produce Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Uses techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Uses and supervises the application of techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined in the Green Book, in order to apply Cost-Benefit Analysis.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: · Where appropriate, demonstrates the ability to develop and improve techniques used and actively participate in quality- assurance procedures and processes.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: · Critically reviews and suggests improvements to techniques to establish/identify robust counterfactuals to effectively measure policy impact and causation as detailed in the Magenta Book.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Supervises the application of and critically assesses techniques such as monetisation and discounting as outlined by the Green Book, in order to apply Cost Benefit Analysis. Where needed, this includes balancing conflicting methods and techniques used in the analysis and managing the quality-assurance process.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: · Critically reviews and suggests improvements to techniques used by the team to establish/identify robust counterfactuals to effectively measure policy impact and causation as detailed in the Magenta Book.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Influences stakeholders at all levels to ensure cutting edge, timely appraisal is carried out and influences decisions.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: · Takes a strategic approach to longer term development of techniques and tools available.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Actively engages in wider learning and development to support formal learning.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Develops oneself as a professional economist by continuing to seek out training and support that enables confident delivery of the above.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Develops oneself as a professional economist by continuing to seek out training, teaching and coaching opportunities as well as promoting economics that enables confident delivery of the above.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Keeps up to date with relevant academic literature, developments in data science, techniques (e.g. behavioural insights) and contributes to wider debates within the organisation and economic profession.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Operates with credibility in an inclusive way, is accountable for the work of the team(s) (where applicable) and champions the economics profession including volunteering as a GES Assessor as per requirements.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Seeks out mentoring opportunities and/or acts as a mentor (formally or informally) to GES Apprentices, HEOs and SEOs.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Seeks out opportunities to embed D&I learning to enable inclusive approaches.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Keeps up to date with the latest relevant academic literature, developments in data science, techniques (e.g., behavioural insights) and contributes to wider debates within the organisation and economic profession.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Operates with credibility in an inclusive way, is accountable for the work of the team(s) (where applicable) and champions the economics profession.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Actively keeps abreast of, and contributes to, relevant economic developments within and outside the Department, including internationally, adopting, and promoting good practice.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Acts as a mentor to GES Apprentices, HEOs SEOs and G7s.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Engages in senior management events and leadership training sessions to build capability and influence others.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Acts as a mentor to G6/G7s.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Can lead and coach policy/economic colleagues and Ministers through analysis and support their understanding.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Oversees the development of economists by ensuring training and support is accessible.

heading: Application of Knowledge
content: Provide highest level QA in line with departmental processes.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Understands various statistical techniques and can explain choice of method of analysis.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Considers how data being used has been constructed and what impact this might have on the analysis.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Effectively applies appropriate statistical and spreadsheet software to deliver analysis.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Can determine and apply the appropriate approach from a range of economic and other analytical tools, use judgement where data is incomplete and consider the context.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Seeks input from colleagues/seniors on appropriate data sources and learns to confidently use these.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Reviews, synthesises, and is able to critique and quality assure the analysis of others to ensure it is of high quality.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Provides appropriate challenge to methods and results, and continually evaluates the quality of analysis to ensure that the Department is producing robust economic analysis which can stand up to scrutiny.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Seeks opportunities to review the work of others and to consider its reuse for the benefit of self/team. This may include advising on appropriate data sources.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Analyses and handles data for the purposes of producing evidence to directly advise decision makers as well as the wider team.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Is proactive and innovative in considering how the data / analysis will be used by non-economists, stakeholders, and Ministers.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Is able to steer and challenge where appropriate the analysis, results and evidence produced to advise decision makers as well as the wider team.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Is able to identify and interrogate the critical assumptions to understand the strengths and weaknesses of the analysis and the robustness of results and the implications for policy. Is pro-active in communicating these to decision makers.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Is aware of core QA methods of own work and open to peer review and QA from others.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Provides appropriate challenge to methods and results.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Continually develops and evaluates the quality of analysis to ensure that the department is producing robust economic analysis which can stand up to scrutiny.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Designs Quality Assurance processes and applies them, following departmental best practice , and drawing on sources of external expertise; critically assesses economic analysis and improves it.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Provides appropriate and proportionate critique and challenge to methods and results, in line with the Aqua book..

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Continually develops and evaluates the quality of analysis to ensure that the department is producing robust economic analysis which can stand up to scrutiny.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Ensures that appropriate quality-assurance procedures (see aqua book) for economic models are in place and contributes to their implementation

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Continually develops and evaluates the quality of analysis to ensure that the department is producing robust economic analysis which can stand up to scrutiny.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Challenges input data and assumptions and interprets output data for the purposes of providing supporting evidence, in line with the Aqua Book.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Leads quality-assurance processes and determines the right level (e.g., team level, unit level, directorate level, external peer review, etc.).

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Challenges input data and assumptions and interprets output data for the purposes of providing supporting evidence on a wider array of topics, in line with the Aqua Book.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Ensures profession approved government wide standards (recruitment, development, promotion) are applied in a structured way and maintained within a positive culture of transparent assurance in the department.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Being accountable and signing off on key documents.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Provides the highest level of QA in line with departmental processes.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Learns about data sources and undertakes training to understand the qualities of datasets

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Builds knowledge of data available in own work area and learns the limitations of these datasets

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Create and quality assure datasets with appropriate rigour.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Advises colleagues on the most appropriate source, handling and processing of data sets based on best evidence/economic theory and analysis to form estimates about outcomes of likely policies.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Advises team colleagues on the most appropriate source, handling, and processing of data sets based on best evidence/economic theory and identifies when to bring in data experts as necessary.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Influences development of new data sources to maintain or improve analytical capabilities.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Acquires knowledge of how models can be used to inform analysis.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Develops ability to run economic models, under supervision.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Develops a good understanding of how models can inform analysis, and of their limitations.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Able to communicate effectively what the model results show.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Supervises analysis informed by economic models, assuring all parts of the process (Inputs, Technical Operation, Outputs, Analysis, and Communication of results).

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Ensures that economic models are quality assured, consistent with the principles outlined in the Aqua Book.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Can make the case to non-technical stakeholders for how new or existing Economic Modelling / Estimation / Forecasting could help to inform work, policy and departmental objectives.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Is accountable for the governance of models, with structured quality assurance and approval processes.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Using Economic models to inform analysis
content: Ensures modelling stands up to external scrutiny, engaging across government and beyond.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Understands what assumptions have been made and why.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Applies appropriate assumptions to analysis and clearly communicates the rationale and the associated risks.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Is able to interpret analytical outputs.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Can evaluate assumptions made by self and other.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Understands of impact of assumptions on results.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Identifies disparities, considers options to resolve and recommends. analytical solutions.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Ensures that assumptions underpinning results are transparently presented with results.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Identifies key risks and assesses impact on results with sensitivity analysis.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Identifies disparities with wider context and where disparities exist, including with findings from other teams, challenges with staff and provides support to resolve.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Works with teams to ensure assumptions are clearly and transparently presented with results.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Works with teams to identify key risks and offer advice and challenge on sensitivities to test them.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Ensures key information is distilled for senior and ministerial audiences without loss of rigour.

heading: Analysis of Data
sub-heading: Understanding results, including identifying assumptions, risks and sensitivities
content: Influences decisions to mitigate key risks, understands sensitivities in advice given.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Skill not normally expected at grade, but initiative and learning are part of the apprenticeship programme.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: With support, will be able to identify opportunities for econometric analysis and carry it out depending on previous academic training.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Will continue to invest in learning within this area.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Generally well placed to identify opportunities for econometric analysis and carry it out depending on previous academic and work training.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Where relevant, applies econometric knowledge to fully understand how model inputs are estimated as well as being aware of issues related to model specification and efficiency and how they impact on estimates.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Where relevant, identified opportunities for the team to apply econometric knowledge, including fully understanding how model inputs are estimated as well as being aware of issues related to model specification and efficiency and how they impact on estimates.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Adopts a wider perspective with regards modelling best practice, enables high quality data and systems to perform best practice econometrics where beneficial.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Develops ability to use Excel and other software packages, is willing to continuously improve skills.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Is comfortable with applying and developing skills with Excel and other relevant software packages.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Develops and applies advanced skills in using Excel and other relevant software packages.

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Ensures self and team have relevant skills and resources to be comfortable using relevant software packages (Excel, and others as used in relevant department e.g., SPSS, STATA, R, SAS, etc.).

heading: Analysis of Data
content: Ensures team has relevant skills and resources to be comfortable using relevant software packages (Excel, and others as used in relevant department e.g., SPSS, STATA, R, SAS, etc.).

content: Ensures economists within departments are adequately resourced with learning software relevant for their roles but also future progression.

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Knowledge of research and analytical methodologies and ability to demonstrate practical application of both qualitative and quantitative approaches through project based work; for example, a suitable level of experience would be that obtained from obtaining a 1st or 2:1 degree or a postgraduate qualification in a social science discipline, that includes a substantial element of social research methods and training

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Working knowledge of a range of research methods and an awareness of new innovative methods, including within the data science field.

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Broad awareness of the role of quantitative and qualitative social research methods and their application, i.e., knowing when their application is appropriate and when it is not

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Uses both qualitative and quantitative approaches to undertake small in-house pieces of work while under supervision

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Carries out analytical tasks under directions

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Knowledge of research methods, techniques & application of these in small scale research projects
content: Prepares accurate statistics

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Designs small scale and less complex research projects for either in-house or commissioned projects; understands how to get things done in the Civil Service

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Helps line manager identify areas for new research

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Writes and designs draft research specifications for less complex projects

heading: Technical Skills
sub-heading: Identifying research needs, designing & specifying research
content: Defines research questions, and re-defines where necessary

heading: Technical Skills
content: Makes use of different sources of information and carries out basic analysis of key data sets by producing frequencies and cross tabulations; interprets the key findings from this

heading: Technical Skills
content: Uses computer software in the analysis and presentation of information

heading: Technical Skills
content: Working knowledge of relevant data analysis packages, particularly SPSS and Excel, and qualitative packages. Packages to be determined by the particular role and job content

heading: Technical Skills
content: Introductory level knowledge of data science techniques

content: Makes use of different analytical disciplines and diverse talents to deliver results

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Facilitates and links the ideas and contributions from a range of analytical disciplines to generate robust solutions

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Collaborates with other senior analysts and policy colleagues to develop a coherent and integrated research vision that reflects the contribution of each discipline, creates synergy and demonstrates excellent cross functional awareness

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Understands the implications of the latest research evidence for own policy areas; shares this information with key stakeholders and customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Anticipates customers' priorities; systematically ensures the unit's research capability and evidence base is relevant to the short term and strategic priorities of key customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Influences the customer's research priorities; internal dialogue and research agenda through asking them the right questions

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Acutely aware of the potential political implications for customers of the research and develops contingency plans on how to manage this

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Works in partnership with customers to develop policy/delivery action plans in light of research findings

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Keeps abreast of key developments within the department as well as in the wider internal and external research community

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Proposes and defends a position taking into account political and organisational sensitivities even in challenging situations, for example, stands up to ministers on matters of research publication

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets out the policy and political consequences of research results so these wider implications are readily understood

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Quality assures the social research output conducted by the unit; proactively links output to the strategic needs of the department

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Motivates staff by instilling professional integrity and high professional standards; encourages breadth and depth of research skills and knowledge and their application to effective delivery of policy

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Actively promotes a work culture that encourages the use of innovative research methods and analytical techniques; challenges staff to consider new methods in social research and evaluation and how they can be applied to the policy delivery context

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets and promotes a learning and improving culture in the unit for all staff; ensures access and opportunities are equal across the unit, for example, considers training across analytical disciplines

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Exposes staff to the wider professional community of social researchers and other analytical disciplines to facilitate learning

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Mediates effectively when there is a professional dispute, for example, on issues of methodology, or the use of social research evidence in a particular context; able to judge whether disputes are of critical importance and knows when to step in and when not to

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Engagingly and accurately communicates relevant findings from complex research programmes to senior people and influential audiences, to give politically aware advice that informs policy and practice

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Sets a learning culture for all staff, instilling professional integrity and high professional standards in line with the GSR code, encouraging breadth and depth in research skills including innovative methodologies and techniques and good understanding of other analytical disciplines

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Demonstrates excellent cross functional awareness, making use of different analytical disciplines to deliver robust solutions, collaborating with senior analysts and policy colleagues to develop a coherent and integrated research vision that reflects the contribution of each analytical discipline and meets customer needs

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Champions excellence in social research practices and application, creates intelligent customers and builds customer base, builds and maintains influential relationships with the ‘top of the office’ and key stakeholders outside government, presenting a compelling case for the value of social research.

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Uses understanding of evidence base, policy area and customers priorities to influence research priorities. Ensures policy and political implications of research are understood and managed, develops policy / delivery action plans in partnership with customers and ensures research capability and evidence base is relevant to short term and strategic priorities of key customers

heading: Using and Promoting Social Research
content: Provides strategic leadership to further develop the social research profession and its role in the broader analytical community

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Seeks opportunities to learn from colleagues

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Takes seriously own professional development

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Operates with professionalism and integrity in all aspects of analytical work including conduct, adherence to Codes of practice and working in best interests of the Department. Maintains best practice and works to Departmental standards.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Demonstrates importance of quality assurance checks through building them into own work, securing assistance from peers and more senior colleagues. Raises and escalates risks where identified.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Participates in wider Department OR and GORS activities and builds professional networks.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Takes seriously own professional development and undertakes 100 hours of continuous professional development per year.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Provides quality and product assurance for others, escalate risks if quality and product assurance is compromised.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Provides induction to junior staff on the role of OR within the Department and business area.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Provides guidance to junior staff on how to get the most out of their training and professional development

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Contributes to wider GORS activities and builds analytical professional networks.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Displays professionalism and uses best practice in the performing and communication of analytical work

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Make suggestions on areas where OR could make a contribution to own team’s work

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Carries out robust quality assurance on analytical work and ensures that products are fit for purpose and are used to best effect.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Supports the direction for OR professionals across the business area and supports the Departmental OR community.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Contributes to wider GORS activities and extends professional networks across the analytical professions and broader department

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Promotes professionalism and exemplifies best practice in the performing and communication of analytical work. Ensures that projects are managed well, and fully documented.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Allocates time for and makes sure that appropriate quality assurance is carried out and engages with customers so that they understand the level off assurance provided, and limitations and caveats of the analysis.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Suggests and makes effective use of opportunities to promote the OR profession within the business area, seeking out areas where OR can make a contribution.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Supports GORS recruitment, induction of high quality OR professionals in the GORS community. Supports progressive professional development, including time to explore the newest techniques and technologies.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Sets direction for OR professionals across the business area, supports the Dept. OR community and proactively contributes to wider GORS business goals.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Instils professionalism and integrity in all aspects of analytical work, delivers GORS best practice ensuring that work is appropriately quality assured.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Promotes OR group's reputation for professionalism, good service, and most advanced analysis; suggests areas where OR can make a contribution.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Appropriately selects and oversees the work of external OR staff (consultants, academics).

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Develops and agrees quality and product assurance requirements with customers and analysts at the start of analytical projects, building in sufficient time for delivery.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Manages quality and product assurance issues, escalating to stakeholders and external experts as appropriate.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Ensures GORS approved, government wide standards for professional OR staff (recruitment, professional development and promotion) are maintained and applied with the Department.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Ensure active contribution to the Government Operational Research Service (GORS) and Departmental commitment on continuing professional development for OR analysts.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Leads on the OR capability within the Department through setting the overall direction, identifying future needs, and embracing future advancements seen in OR outside government and in other Government Departments. Works to facilitate, promote, and mainstream GORS professional activities, ensuring OR is recognised within the Department as most current standard of analysis.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Pushes for the latest appropriate technologies, to enable useful new analytical techniques.

heading: Sustaining and developing OR professionals and professionalism
content: Ensures that appropriate quality and product assurance processes are in place and are monitored, consulting with stakeholders and external experts when required.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Develops knowledge and understanding of strengths and limitations of OR techniques applied in team’s area. Develops experience in the practical application of techniques to own work area.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Can explain why the approach taken in own work area is appropriate.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Recognises the importance of data quality, identifying and raising issues relevant to work.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Develops a growing knowledge and understanding of a range of hard and soft OR techniques and problem solving approaches. Develops experience in the practical application of a range of techniques.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Suggests possible approaches to a given problem.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Understands data limitations.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Helps break down complex problems into a clear structure and formulates specific questions that can be tackled through analysis of available data and modelling.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Has good knowledge and depth of understanding of a number of OR techniques and a growing awareness of a range of hard and soft analytical techniques.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Helps to translate customer requests into practical and effective approaches to the solution of customers' problems and has good knowledge about the strengths and limitations of the data and techniques available.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Develops the understanding of different data structures, and how to make them usable.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Stays abreast of developments in Government OR and exploits these as appropriate to break new ground in own work area.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Leads in breaking down complex problems into a clear structure and formulates specific questions that can be tackled through analysis of available data and modelling.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Has extensive knowledge and depth of understanding of a number of OR techniques and demonstrates a breadth of knowledge, across a range of hard and soft analytical techniques.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Takes critical and informed views of possible approaches given customer needs and is fully knowledgeable about the strengths and limitations of the data and techniques available.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Develops the understanding of different data structures, and how to make them usable.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Stays abreast of developments in Government OR and exploits these as appropriate to break new ground in own work area.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Maintains, develops and uses professional networks within the Civil Service and externally in order to maintain knowledge of activity and enable innovations in analysis.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Adequate, innovative and appropriate application of OR to the formulation, implementation and evaluation of projects.  Ensures that evaluation of projects takes place and work is quality assured.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Awareness of quality assurance techniques and ensure the appropriate application of techniques to deliver robust analytical models and results.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Explores new uses of departmental administrative data, and relevant open data, as enabled by new technologies and techniques.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Adequate and appropriate application of OR to the formulation, implementation and evaluation of projects: formulates and produces innovative projects; assesses and constructively challenges proposed projects; and ensures evaluation of projects and other work is undertaken.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Reviews and evaluates the effectiveness and value of OR input and use of analytical methods and tools within the Department.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Develops Departmental OR expertise, encompassing new techniques as appropriate, to meet current and future analytical requirements.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Champions and sets direction for major proposals for analytical work programmes involving OR contributions, ensuring the contribution made by OR supports the aims and objectives of the Department.

heading: Knowledge and application of OR skills and techniques
content: Ensures adequate and appropriate application of OR to the formulation, implementation and evaluation of policies and programmes: formulates and produces innovative options for policies and programmes; assesses and constructively challenges proposed policies and programmes; and ensures evaluation of projects and other work is planned for and undertaken.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Identifies key messages from analytical work, able to translate these into terms for use with either technical or non-technical audiences

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Reports own analytical work in sufficient detail, meeting customer needs, effectively presenting results in both written and oral form.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Explains clearly the analytical evidence resulting from own analysis and the implications for the project and policies being analysed.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Communicates key messages from analytical work in clear and concise lay terms for a variety of audiences.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Reports fully own analytical work in sufficient detail meeting customer needs, effectively presenting results in both written and oral form.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Explains clearly to senior officials the implications of analytical evidence for the project and policies being analysed, and make recommendations based on results of analysis.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Describes how a piece of analysis they have carried out has been influenced by their understanding of the stakeholders’ needs.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Explains results or insights from their analysis, conveying difficult concepts to a non-analytical colleagues.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Describes how they have explained the limitations or uncertainties in their analysis and what this means for the business or policy area.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Delivers presentations of OR and analytical work, appropriately tailored to a range of internal and external analytical audiences. Has included the "big picture" or context in presentations of analytical work

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Can explain one problem structuring method and one hard OR method to non-analysts.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Demonstrates an awareness of the popularised lay terms for analysis (data science, analytics, big data).

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Writes or contributes significantly to a technical report, and describes how they structured and approached writing the report.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Gathers information about stakeholders' needs and uses this along with an understanding of the context to design a piece of analysis to meet their needs.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Demonstrates a wider understanding of the context of their analysis by describing how they used their contacts, background reading and other research to develop this.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Communicates key messages to senior officials and able to explain a difficult concept to non-analytical colleagues.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Fully knowledgeable about strengths and limitations of analysis and underlying data, and can describe how they have explored uncertainty in a piece of analysis and how they explained the implications to the client.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Presents results of analysis to senior officials, external stakeholders and/or analytical audiences, with the context clearly explained and the impact of the analysis effectively communicated.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Can explain two or more problem structuring methods and/or hard OR methods to non-analysts and can show how they could be used together to address a business need.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Describes how the OR techniques they use fit with popularised lay terms used for analysis (for example, data science, analytics, etc.).

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Leads on the production of a technical report involving collaboration with others. Demonstrates how they ensured the report was quality assured and fit for purpose.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Gives authoritative advice on evidence and data, and their sources.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Convinces senior officials on the implications of analytical evidence in a wide context.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Ensures junior analysts are aware of popularised lay terms for analytical techniques

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Delivers confident and engaging presentations of OR and analytical work, to a wide range of internal and external audiences.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Communicates key messages from analytical work in clear and concise lay terms for Ministers and senior officials.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Reviews findings and recommendations of analytical work with senior officials and able to convince Ministers and senior officials on policy and programme implications of analytical evidence.

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Delivers confident and engaging presentations of OR and analytical work, to a wide range of audiences (Board level, major conferences etc).

heading: Achieving impact with analysis
content: Demonstrates proven examples where analysis has impacted on eventual outcome of the work, or a change in direction based on evidence.
